member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray
member.summary: Implements the basic functionality common to control arrays in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether a control is a member of a control array.
member.returns: true if the control is a member of the control array; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.BaseGetIndex(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets the index of a control in a control array.
member.returns: A Short integer representing the index of the control in the control array.
member.param: The for which you want to retrieve the index.

member.summary: Gets the control for a specified index in a control array.

member.param: An integer that represents the index of the control in the control array.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.BaseResetIndex(System.Object)
member.summary: Not supported in the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.BaseSetIndex(System.Object,System.Int16,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the index for a control in a control array.
member.param: The for which you want to set the index.
A Short integer that represents the index for the control.
Optional. A Boolean specifying whether the control was created at design time (false) or at run time (true).

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.BaseShouldSerializeIndex(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether a control is a member of a control array.
member.returns: true if the control is a member of the control array; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Begins the initialization of the control.

member.summary: Stores the container for a control array.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.controlAddedAtDesignTime
member.summary: Stores values to track whether a control in a control array was created at design time or at run time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.controls
member.summary: Stores values that represent the controls in a control array.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of controls in a control array.
member.returns: A Short that contains the number of controls.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by a control in a control array and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.System#ComponentModel#ISupportInitialize#EndInit
member.summary: Ends the initialization of a control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.fIsEndInitCalled
member.summary: Stores a value indicating whether the initialization code for a control array's container has finished executing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.GetControlInstanceType
member.summary: Returns the type of a control in a control array.
member.returns: This method must be overridden.The class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0. Because this class is not typically used to create an instance of the class, this Protected method is usually not called directly but is instead called by a derived class.NoteFunctions and objects in the namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic in Visual Studio 11 Developer Preview. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns a reference to an enumerator object, which is used to iterate over a control array.
member.returns: A object.

member.summary: Adds event handlers for a control in a control array.

member.summary: Removes a control from a control array.

It is provided only because the control inherits from .NoteFunctions and objects in the namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.
